2.text: What—thou hast helped the powerless, Saved an arm not strong!

3.text: What—thou hast given counsel to the unwise, And wise plans in abundance made known.

4.text: With whom hast thou declared words? And whose breath came forth from thee?

5.text: The Rephaim are formed, Beneath the waters, also their inhabitants.

6.text: Naked is Sheol over-against Him, And there is no covering to destruction.

7.text: Stretching out the north over desolation, Hanging the earth upon nothing,

8.text: Binding up the waters in His thick clouds, And the cloud is not rent under them.

9.text: Taking hold of the face of the throne, Spreading over it His cloud.

10.text: A limit He hath placed on the waters, Unto the boundary of light with darkness.

11.text: Pillars of the heavens do tremble, And they wonder because of His rebuke.

12.text: By His power He hath quieted the sea, And by His understanding smitten the proud.

13.text: By His Spirit the heavens He beautified, Formed hath His hand the fleeing serpent.

14.text: Lo, these are the borders of His way, And how little a matter is heard of Him, And the thunder of His might Who doth understand?
